Functions
renderLandingPageDistinctly
function renderLandingPageDistinctly()

Renders the landing page distinctly.  Calls the renderLandingPage function.

renderLogin
function renderLogin()

Loads the login.html in the root element of the index.html.  Attaches the EventListener for the submit button.

closeInfoContainer
function closeInfoContainer(
listItem,
itemCourseName
)

Closes the info container by checking if the container has attribute "has-info-container" set to yes.  After closing the attribute "has-info-container" is set to no.

Parameters
{HTMLElement} listItem

The node which should be closed

{String} itemCourseName

The course name of the item

closeStatisticsContainer
function closeStatisticsContainer(
listItem,
itemCourseName
)

Closes the statistics container by checking if the container has attribute "has-info-container" set to yes.  After closing the attribute "has-info-container" is set to no.

Parameters
{HTMLElement} listItem

The node which should be closed

{String} itemCourseName

The course name of the item

closeAddAttendeesContainer
function closeAddAttendeesContainer(
listItem,
itemCourseName
)

Closes the attendees container for adding participants by checking if the container has attribute "has-info-container" set to yes.  After closing the attribute "has-info-container" is set to no.

Parameters
{HTMLElement} listItem

The node which should be closed

{String} itemCourseName

The course name of the item

closeAddDatesContainer
function closeAddDatesContainer(
listItem,
itemCourseName
)

Closes the dates container for adding dates by checking if the container has attribute "has-info-container" set to yes.  After closing the attribute "has-info-container" is set to no.

Parameters
{HTMLElement} listItem

The node which should be closed

{String} itemCourseName

The course name of the item

closeContainers
function closeContainers(
listItem,
itemCourseName,
closeContainerFunctions
)

The function calls other closing functions which are explained above.  Helper for closing more than one container.

Parameters
{HTMLElement} listItem

The node which should be closed

{String} itemCourseName

The course name of the item

{Array} closeContainerFunctions

Contains closing functions which are called within

renderInfoContainerContent
function renderInfoContainerContent(
courseName
)

Renders the info container which should be opened if someone clicks on it.

Parameters
{String} courseName

The name of the course from which the info container should be opened

handleOnDragStart
function handleOnDragStart(
event
)

Handles the onDrag EventListener. Sets the opacity of the dragged item and data to identify the element in the Drop EventListener.

Parameters
{Event} event

The event which is triggered

handleOnDrop
function handleOnDrop(
event
)

Handles the onDrop EventListener. Sets the opacity back to one and checks if the elements can be added to the drop target or not.

Parameters
{Event} event

The event which is triggered

handleOnDragOver
function handleOnDragOver(
event
)

Handles the onDragOver EventListener. Sets the dropEffect to copy.

Parameters
{Event} event

The event which is triggered

addAttendees
function addAttendees(
list,
classNameArray,
value,
courseName,
id
)

Adding attendees to the list and setting the elements to draggable.  The EventListener for onDragStart is set.

Parameters
{HTMLElement} list

The list is added to this node

{Array} classNameArray

Containing {String} names of html classes which are added to the list elements

{String} value

The name of the user, who should be added to the course

{String} courseName

The course name to which the user should be added

{String} id

A unique  id which identifies the user

genericAddListItem
function genericAddListItem(
list,
classNameArray,
value,
id
)

Adding attendees to list without setting them to draggable.

Parameters
{HTMLElement} list

The list is added to this node

{Array} classNameArray

Containing {String} names of html classes which are added to the list elements

{String} value

The name of the user, who should be added to the course

{String} courseName

The course name to which the user should be added

{String} id

A unique  id which identifies the user

handleDragAndDrop
function handleDragAndDrop(
container,
courseName
)

HelperFunction to attach all necessary drag and drop EventListener and id attributes.

Parameters
{HTMLElement} container

The container in which the drag and drop is happening

{Array} courseName

The name of the course in which the attendees are dragged.

renderAttendeesContainer
function renderAttendeesContainer(
courseName,
courseItemNode
)

Renders the container in which the attendees from the chosen course are shown and the box for drag and drop.  The drag and drop handler function is called.

Parameters
{String} courseName

The name of the course

{HTMLElement} courseItemNode

The course node

function updateAttendeesCount(

courseItemNode
)

Updates the attendees number information if attendees are added to the course.

Parameters

{HTMLElement} courseItemNode

The course node

getDateFromDateTimePicker
function getDateFromDateTimePicker(
datetimepickerID
)

Fetches the date which are added in the datepicker.

Parameters
{String} datetimepickerID

the unique id of the datepicker

Returns

A firestore timestamp

initDatetimepicker
function initDatetimepicker(
datetimepickerID
)

Initializes the datetimepicker.

Parameters
{String} datetimepickerID

the unique id of the datepicker

renderInfoContainer
function renderInfoContainer(
e
)

EventListener function which renders the info container that gets attached after clicking on the course name.

Parameters

Click event

attachInfoContainerEventListeners
function attachInfoContainerEventListeners(
infoContainer,
courseNameOfCurrentItem,
courseItemNode
)

Attaches EventListener for adding attendees and adding dates to the info container.

Parameters
{HTMLElement} infoContainer

The info container element

{String} courseNameOfCurrentItem

The name of the current course item

{HTMLElement} courseItemNode

The node of the course item

initializeCourseContainerFromCourseObject
function initializeCourseContainerFromCourseObject(
courseObject,
elementToInitialize
)

Initializes the course container corresponding to the course object.

Parameters
{Object} courseObject

The course object which contains name, num, participants and dates

{HTMLElement} elementToInitialize

The element which should be initialized

handleBackButton
function handleBackButton(
e
)

Handles if the back button is clicked. The EventListener is removed after clicking the button.

Parameters
{Event} e

Click Event

renderCourseCreationContainer
function renderCourseCreationContainer()

Renders the container for creating a new course. Attaches EventListeners to the container.

handleCourseCreation
function handleCourseCreation(
e
)

Handles if a new course is created. Calls the renderLandingPage function so that the new course is shown in the view.  Parameters: {Event} e - Click Event

hideAddCourseContainer
function hideAddCourseContainer()

Sets the AddCourseContainer to display "none".

renderLandingPage
function renderLandingPage(
isAdmin
)

Renders the landing page and starts the WebWorker.

Parameters
{Bool} isAdmin

Boolean to check if user is Admin

)

contains the course objects which should be shown to the user

)

header
)

Renders the landing page for the admin.  Function for attaching EventListeners for the admin is called.

Parameters
{HTMLElement} header

The header element

attachCommonEventListenersToLandingPage
function attachCommonEventListenersToLandingPage()

Attaches all relevant EventListeners for user and admin.

attachAdminEventListenersToLandingPage
function attachAdminEventListenersToLandingPage()

Attaches all relevant EventListeners for the admin.

attachUserEventListenersToLandingPage
function attachUserEventListenersToLandingPage()

Attaches all relevant EventListeners for the user.

renderProfilePage
function renderProfilePage()

Renders the profile container for the user if he clicks at "Profil" in the header.

renderRegistrationPage
function renderRegistrationPage()

Renders the registration container for the admin if he clicks at "Neue Registrierung" in the header.

hideCourseList
function hideCourseList()

Hides the course list.
